page.title: 18HAYFIELD SCHOOL,HAYFIELD.
page.content: Hayfield County Primary School is a split-site School. The new building, in which the infants are housed,was opened in 1978,and is due to be extended in 1985. When the new part is opened,all the school will be finally on one site again. The old building,which is situated in the heart of the village,was built in 1888 of Yorkshire Best stone from the now disused Offerwell Quarry in Hayfield.It has a veranda, built 40 years ago. When it first opened,the school was divided up into boys and girls.You can still see where the ralings were to seperate then.We are looking forward to moving into the New building because we will have a hall/gym,showers and a canteen.It will be nice to be one big school again,instead of being split up .
